title: Application of a Motivation-Driven Instructional Design Model for Post-Stroke Rehabilitation Therapy

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental stroke concepts, overview of rehabilitation therapy, and foundational social welfare knowledge
context.additional_context: Rehabilitation therapy education design simulation and case analysis based on the ARCS model

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to apply the four elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) to stroke rehabilitation programs
Learners can design and evaluate motivation strategies in occupational therapy (OT) and swallowing therapy (ST) scenarios
Specific educational intervention strategies can be proposed to enhance participation in rehabilitation therapy
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
